page.title: 03FARMLAND IN KILWINNING
page.content: Farmland surrounds much of the town.Originally woodland but now grassland which has been divided into small farms.The land to the west is poor while the best pastures for providing sufficient grazing are to the north,east,and south-east.Dairy farming predominates.A typical farm is Castle Farm owned by Mr.Reid.He has fifty Friesian cows,a sheep dog and hens.He works hard looking after the land,maintaining two ancient tractors, and keeping his fences in good order. Like many farms in the area his farm is small,only fourteen acres,but his farmhouse is large,attractive and in good order.
